question.text: The open-chain glucose on oxidation with <math><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> gives

options.text: <math><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>

<math><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>

<math><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>

<math><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>

solution.text: Both CHO and CHOH form HCOOH; while HOCH2 forms H2C=O giving 5HCOOH+H2C=O .
